oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The John Crockett Tavern at Morristown, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Reconstructed boyhood home of Davy Crockett as well as the tavern and inn his family ran in the 1700s. A basement contains the Crockett Pioneer Museum with period artifacts. The original building was burned after it housed smallpox victims.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Log buildings; Taverns
